name: Slider
description: The Slider component provides a visual indication of adjustable value.

props.name: value
props.doc: The `value` of the slider as a number or an array. If an array with numbers is provided, each number will represent a thumb button (the `+` and `-` button will be hidden on multiple thumbs).

props.name: min
props.doc: The minimum value. Can be a negative number as well. Defaults to `0`.

props.name: max
props.doc: The maximum value. Defaults to `100`.

props.name: step
props.doc: The steps the slider takes on changing the value. Defaults to `null`.

props.name: vertical
props.doc: Show the slider vertically. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: reverse
props.doc: Show the slider reversed. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: stretch
props.doc: If set to `true`, then the slider will be 100% in `width`.

props.name: hideButtons
props.doc: Removes the helper buttons. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: multiThumbBehavior
props.doc: Use either `omit`, `push` or `swap`. This property only works for two (range) or more thumb buttons, while `omit` will stop the thumb from swapping, `push` will push its nearest thumb along. Defaults to `swap`.

props.name: thumbTitle
props.doc: Give the slider thumb button a title for accessibility reasons. Defaults to `null`.

props.name: subtractTitle
props.doc: Give the subtract button a title for accessibility reasons. Defaults to `Decrease (%s)`.

props.name: addTitle
props.doc: Give the add button a title for accessibility reasons. Defaults to `Increase (%s)`.

props.name: numberFormat
props.doc: Will extend the return object with a `number` property (from `onChange` event). You can use all the options from the [NumberFormat](/uilib/components/number-format/properties) component. It also will use that formatted number in the increase/decrease buttons. If it has to represent a currency, then use e.g. `numberFormat={{ currency: true, decimals: 0 }}`.

props.name: tooltip
props.doc: Use `true` to show a tooltip on `mouseOver`, `touchStart` and `focus`, showing the current number (if `numberFormat` is given) or the raw value.

props.name: alwaysShowTooltip
props.doc: Use `true` to always show the tooltip, in addition to the `tooltip` property.

props.name: label
props.doc: Prepends the Form Label component. If no ID is provided, a random ID is created.

props.name: labelDirection
props.doc: Use `labelDirection="vertical"` to change the label layout direction. Defaults to `horizontal`.

props.name: labelSrOnly
props.doc: Use `true` to make the label only readable by screen readers.

props.name: status
props.doc: Text with a status message. The style defaults to an error message. You can use `true` to only get the status color, without a message.

props.name: statusState
props.doc: Defines the state of the status. Currently, there are two statuses `[error, info]`. Defaults to `error`.

props.name: statusProps
props.doc: Use an object to define additional FormStatus properties.

props.name: globalStatusId
props.doc: The `status_id` used for the target [GlobalStatus](/uilib/components/global-status).

props.name: suffix
props.doc: Text describing the content of the Slider more than the label. You can also send in a React component, so it gets wrapped inside the Slider component.

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.

props.name: extensions
props.doc: Makes it possible to display overlays with other functionality such as a marker on the slider marking a given value.

events.name: onChange
events.doc: will be called on state changes made by the user. The callback `value` and `rawValue` is a number `{ value, rawValue, event }`. But if the prop `numberFormat` is given, then it will return an additional `number` with the given format `{ value, number, rawValue, event }`.

events.name: onDragStart
events.doc: will be called once the user stops dragging. Returns `{ event }`.

events.name: onDragEnd
events.doc: will be called once the user starts dragging. Returns `{ event }`.
